definition.name: NXcircuit
definition.doc:
Base class for documenting circuit devices.
Electronic circuits are hardware components that connect several electronic components to achieve specific functionality, e.g. amplifying a voltage or convert a voltage to binary numbers, etc.

group.name: hardware
group.doc: Hardware where the circuit is implanted; includes information about the hardware manufacturers and type (e.g. part number) All the elements below may be single numbers of an array of values with length N_channel describing multiple input and output channels.

field.name: components
field.doc: List of components used in the circuit, e.g., resistors, capacitors, transistors or any other complex components.

field.name: connections
field.doc: Description of how components are interconnected, including connection points and wiring.

field.name: power_source
field.doc: Details of the power source for the circuit, including voltage and current ratings.

field.name: signal_type
field.doc: Type of signal (input signal) the circuit is designed to handle, e.g., analog, digital, mixed-signal.

field.name: operating_frequency
field.doc: The operating frequency of the circuit, see also bandwidth, which is possibly but not necessarily centered around this frequency (e.g. running a 100 kHz bandwidth amplifier at low, audio frequencies 1 - 20,000 Hz).

field.name: bandwidth
field.doc: The bandwidth of the frequency response of the circuit.

field.name: gain
field.doc: Gain of the circuit, if applicable, usually all instruments have a gain which might be important or not.

field.name: noise_level
field.doc: Root-mean-square (RMS) noise level (in current or voltage) in the circuit in voltage or current.

field.name: temperature_range
field.doc: Operating temperature range of the circuit.

field.name: offset
field.doc: Offset value for current or voltage.

field.name: output_channels
field.doc: Number of output channels connected to this circuit. Most probably N_channel.

field.name: output_signal
field.doc: Type of output signal, e.g., voltage, current, digital.

field.name: power_consumption
field.doc: Power consumption of the circuit per unit time.

field.name: status_indicators
field.doc: Status indicators for the circuit, e.g., LEDs, display readouts.

field.name: protection_features
field.doc: Protection features built into the circuit, e.g., overvoltage protection, thermal shutdown.

field.name: acquisition_time
field.doc: Updated rate for several processes using the input signal, e.g., History Graph, the circuit uses for any such process.

field.name: output_slew_rate
field.doc: The rate at which the signal changes when ramping from the starting value.
